cost_protocol.usage: Cost operation will be performed for this IGP

cost_threshold_percent.description: Traffic utilization threshold percentage (in decimal format) to check cost process. For example 0.7 means 70%
cost_threshold_percent.usage: If the parameter is set to 0.7, cost out operation is considered successful if the traffic falls to less than 70% of the previous traffic for all interface that is part of the IGP.  Similarly, cost in is considered successful if traffic grows to more than 70% of the previous traffic for all interface part of IGP.

method.description: Costing method when using ISIS protocol, for other use none
method.usage: The chosen method to perform cost operation of IGP

proc_id.description: OSPF/ISIS process id on which cost operation needs to be performed
proc_id.usage: Process id of the protocol under which the costing operation should be performed.

provider.description: Provider to be used to connect to the router

collection_type.description: Collection type to be used for data collection

vrf.description: VRF on which cost operation needs to be performed, when using ospf protocol
vrf.usage: VRF id on which the costing operation should be performed

mop_timeout.description: Timeout duration for MoP i.e. maximum time spent in Running/Paused states. e.g. 900s, 10m, 1.5h, etc. Valid time units are 'ns', 'us' (or 'Âµs'), 'ms', 's', 'm', 'h'.
